Annotation.String: DriveMetrics contains usage and health statistics for a single physical Drive.
This resource shall be used to represent the Drive Metrics for a single physical Drive in a Redfish implementation.
Temperature in degrees Kelvin corresponding to the Drive resource.
The value of this property shall be temperature of the Drive resource in Kelvin degrees.
This object contains the physical Drive metrics for the lifetime of the physical drive.
This object shall contain properties which describe the LifeTime metrics for the current resource.
This object describes the health information of the physical drive.
This object shall contain properties which describe the HealthData metrics for the current resource.
Histogram of the various latency ranges for disk reads.
The value of this property shall provide a way to track latencies experienced internally by the controller for read commands.
Histogram of the various latency rangeis of disk writes.
The value of this property shall provide a way to track latencies experienced internally by the controller for write commands.
Size in bytes corresponding to UnitRead / UnitWrite basic unit.
The value of this property shall be size of a unit (the value is reported in bytes) that is utilized by UnitRead / UnitWrite properties as a basic unit.
Number of units read since reset.
The value of this property shall be number of units of a size UnitSizeBytes read since reset. This can be used to compute average bandwidth by polling the drive at regular intervals.
Number of units written since reset.
The value of this property shall be number of units of a size UnitSizeBytes written since reset. This can be used to compute average bandwidth by polling the drive at regular intervals.
Number of read commands completed by Disk controller since reset.
The value of this property shall be number of number of read commands completed by Disk controller since reset. For NMVe Disk controller specifically, this is number of Compare and Read commands.
Number of write commands completed by Disk controller since reset.
The value of this property shall be number of number of write commands completed by Disk controller since reset.
Contains number of power cycles.
The value of this property shall be number of power cycles of the physical drive.
Contains number of power-on hours.
The value of this property shall be the number of hours the physical drive was powered on. This may not include time that the controller was powered and remained in an non-operational power state.
Contains amount of time (in minutes) the drive controller is busy with I/O commands.
The value of this property shall be amount of time (in minutes) the drive controller is busy with I/O commands.
This object contains the physical Drive metrics for the lifetime of the physical drive.
This type shall describe the metrics of the physical drive since manufacturing.
This type describes the health information of the physical drive.
This type shall contain properties which describe the HealthData metrics for the current resource.
Percentage of the remaining spare capacity available.
The value of this property shall be a normalized percentage (0 to 100%) of the remaining spare capacity available.
Estimate of the percentage of Drive life used based on the actual usage and the manufacturerâ€™s prediction of Drive life
This property shall contain an indicator of the percentage of life remaining in the Drive's media.
Contains the number of unsafe shutdowns of a drive.
The value of this property shall be number of unsafe shutdowns of a drive.
Contains the number of media and data integrity errors of a drive.
The value of this property shall be number of media and data integrity errors of a drive. This includes ECC, CRC checksum failure or LBA tag mismatch errors.
Each property in the histogram shall represent one bucket of the histogram.
Each property in the histogram shall represent one bucket of the histogram.
A set of buckets constituting a histogram of latencies of handling commands.
A set of buckets constituting a histogram of latencies of handling commands.
